intro: Selbyana aromatica, commonly known as the aromatic selbya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its fragrant leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal gardens.
